title: Ratio of government expenditure to gross domestic product ( GDP ) in Mexico 2024
yAxis: Ratio of government expenditure to GDP
summary: This is a line chart with an x axis representing Year and a y axis representing Ratio of government expenditure to GDP, containing a total of 11 data points.
In general Ratio of government expenditure to GDP has fallen over the Year.

Ratio of government expenditure to GDP is roughly constant from 2014 to 2016, gradually decreasing from 2016 to 2017, roughly constant from 2017 to 2019, slightly decreasing from 2019 to 2020, and finally roughly constant from 2020 to 2024.
The steepest decrease occurs in between the Year 2016 and 2017.
The highest Ratio of government expenditure to GDP, of value 27.97 was reached at Year 2014
The lowest Ratio of government expenditure to GDP, of value 24.67 was reported at Year 2021
